His works, which include numerous chamber, solo, orchestral and vocal compositions, have been performed, broadcast and recorded worldwide. Among his many achievements as a composer, educator and public speaker, he has taught at the Haute École de Musique de Genève, the Hochschule für Musik Freiburg and the Strasbourg Center of the University of Syracuse. Currently, he is the vice-president of the Fondation Prince Pierre de Monaco’s music council. A Canadian by birth, he teaches two eight-hour courses on music for Jordan Peterson’s online universal education platform, Peterson Academy. Notably, Andreyev joined YouTube on September 4, 2008, to establish what is now regarded as one of the world’s foremost podcasts for the examination of ideas relating to art music. The following interview took place online in April. Look, it’s always possible to have artistic freedom.
